name: B. Chips
statement:
Gerald plays the following game. He has a checkered field of size cells,
where various cells are banned. Before the game, he has to put a few
chips on some border (but not corner) board cells. Then for minutes,
Gerald every minute moves each chip into an adjacent cell. He moves each
chip from its original edge to the opposite edge. Gerald loses in this
game in each of the three cases: At least one of the chips at least once
fell to the banned cell. At least once two chips were on the same cell.
At least once two chips swapped in a minute (for example, if you stand
two chips on two opposite border cells of a row with even length, this
situation happens in the middle of the row). In that case he loses and
earns points. When nothing like that happened, he wins and earns the
number of points equal to the number of chips he managed to put on the
board. Help Gerald earn the most points.
